TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ListBoxItem extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

Docs.summary: Represents an item in a or control in an application that was upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In Visual Basic 6.0, the `ListBox` and `ComboBox` controls use a `List` property to store list items and an `ItemData` property to optionally store an `Integer` associated with each list item. In [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> controls use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.Items%2A> property to store list items, and the `ItemData` property is no longer supported.
When a Visual Basic 6.0 application is upgraded to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)], the upgrade tools create a `ListBoxItem` class for each item in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control. The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.SetItemData%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.GetItemData%2A> functions can then be used to enable any code that references the `ItemData` property.
[!INCLUDE[Note_compatibility](~/includes/note-compatibility-md.md)]

Docs.param: A that contains the list item.

remarks.format:

The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.SetItemData%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.Support.GetItemData%2A> functions can then be used to enable any code that references the `ItemData` property.
[!INCLUDE[Note_compatibility](~/includes/note-compatibility-md.md)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ListBoxItem> cannot be converted to a <xref:System.String>; you must call the `ToString` method to convert the type.
[!INCLUDE[Note_compatibility](~/includes/note-compatibility-md.md)]
